sources.data_found: UT has acquired high-performance Dell PowerEdge servers and NVIDIA AI infrastructure powered by more than 4,000 NVIDIA Blackwell architecture graphic processing units (GPUs). In total, the University has amassed more than 5,000 advanced NVIDIA GPUs across its academic and research facilities.
The cluster will comprise 600 NVIDIA H100s GPUs. The new cluster, dubbed Vista, will be hosted and supported by the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC).

The system is composed of 560 compute nodes and 88 GPU nodes: 84 A100 GPU nodes and 4 H100 nodes with 2 NVIDIA H100 GPUs each. Each of the system's 84 A100 GPU nodes contains three NVIDIA A100 GPUs each with 40 GB of high bandwidth memory. Additionally, there are 4 H100 GPU nodes that support 2 NVIDIA H100 GPUs.

Stampede3 hosts two types of GPU nodes, Intel's Ponte Vecchio and NVIDIA's H100 nodes. Stampede3 has 24 H100 nodes. Stampede3 hosts 20 nodes with four Intel Data Center GPU Max 1550s 'Ponte Vecchio' (PVC) each.
A 360 NVIDIA Quadro RTX 5000 GPU system. An IBM POWER9-hosted system with 448 NVIDIA V100 GPUs.

The most common Bachelor's Degree concentration at The University of Texas at Austin is General Biological Sciences (590 degrees awarded), followed by General Psychology (514 degrees) and General Computer & Information Sciences (455 degrees). In 2023, 752 degrees were awarded to men at The University of Texas at Austin in General Computer & Information Sciences, which is 2.71 times more than the 277 female recipients with that same degree.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count from Quora response stating 'over 2000 undergraduate students (maybe closer to 2200 or 2300 by now)'. Graduate count of '250 or more graduate students' split between MS and PhD programs. PhD estimate (125) assumes approximately 50% of graduate students are PhD candidates based on typical program distributions. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Frontera system includes 360 NVIDIA Quadro RTX 5000 GPU system submerged in liquid coolant

other_high_vram_gpus.model: Intel Data Center GPU Max 1550 (Ponte Vecchio)
other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Stampede3: 20 nodes × 4 PVC GPUs = 80 Intel Ponte Vecchio GPUs, each with 124GB memory

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATIONS:
1) Vista cluster (Center for Generative AI): 600 H100 GPUs
2) Lonestar6: 84 nodes × 3 A100 = 252 A100 GPUs (40GB); 4 nodes × 2 H100 = 8 H100 GPUs
3) Stampede3: 24 H100 nodes (assuming 1 GPU per node based on documentation)
4) Frontera: 448 V100 GPUs + 360 Quadro RTX 5000 GPUs
5) New Horizon system: 4000+ Blackwell GPUs (counted as B200)

TOTAL H100 = 600 (Vista) + 8 (Lonestar6) + 24 (Stampede3) = 632

UT Austin states they have 'more than 5,000 advanced NVIDIA GPUs' total as of November 2025. The 4000+ Blackwell architecture GPUs are the newest addition for the Horizon supercomputer launching next year.

analysis_notes: UT Austin has established itself as a major academic computing powerhouse with over 5,000 GPUs total. The Center for Generative AI's Vista cluster with 600 H100s represents one of the largest academic AI computing resources. The new Horizon system with 4000+ Blackwell GPUs will make UT the academic leader in open-source AI computing. Student data shows approximately 2,300 undergraduate CS students and 250+ graduate students based on community estimates.
